optionsDefaultStatus.message: Hello! This is Sidewise's options page. Modify your options below.

option_keepSidebarOnTop.message: Keep sidebar visible next to dock window

option_keepSidebarOnTop_hint.message:
!

If enabled, when switching to Chrome from another app, Sidewise will bring the sidebar to the front, so other windows don't obscure or hide it.

Unfortunately, this messes with the OS's native window‑ordering. For example, on Windows, you'll have to Alt‑Tab twice to get back to your last non-Chrome window when this option is enabled.

option_browserActionButtonBehavior.message: When browser toolbar button is clicked

option_browserActionButtonBehavior_hint.message:
If 'show/redock sidebar' is selected, the sidebar will be turned on and docked to the current window when the button is clicked. To close the sidebar in this case, use the close button on the sidebar's title bar.

If 'toggle sidebar on/off' is selected, clicking Sidewise's browser toolbar button will toggle the sidebar on or off.

option_dockState.message: Dock sidebar to this side of the window

option_smartFocusOnClose.message: Use smart focus logic when closing tabs

option_smartFocusOnClose_hint.message:
When enabled and the sidebar is open, Sidewise will use its own tree-oriented logic to decide which tab to focus next after a tab is closed.

The gory details: smart focus uses the following order of priority in picking the next tab to focus:

  1. First child of closed tab
  2. Next sibling of closed tab
  3. Preceding sibling of closed tab
  4. Parent of closed tab
  5. Let Chrome decide

Smart focus starts with the first rule and proceeds down the list until it finds a suitable tab to focus.

If this option is disabled, Sidewise will always let Chrome decide which tab to focus next.

option_smartFocusPrefersCousins.message: Smart focus prefers cousins before parents

option_smartFocusPrefersCousins_hint.message:
When this option is enabled, smart focus will focus later cousin tabs before it focuses its own parent tab.

For example, say you open two tabs, one to reddit.com and one to digg.com. You then open several children tabs underneath each of these two tabs.

If prefer cousins is disabled, once you close the last child tab under reddit.com, the parent reddit.com tab will be focused.

If prefer cousins is enabled, once you close the last child tab under reddit.com, the first child tab under digg.com will be focused instead.

This option is desirable if you open lots of child tabs in this manner and prefer to 'browse forward' through all the child tabs before returning to the parents.

optionsInfoMonitorDetection.message:
Whenever you change your monitor configuration, reload Chrome, then come here and click 'Detect all monitors now' below.

This should be done whenever you add or remove monitors, change monitor resolutions, reposition monitors in your OS settings, or change the location/size of your system taskbars.

optionsInfoMonitorsOnYourSystem.message: Sidewise currently believes you have $1 $2 connected to your system.

option_useAdvancedTreeFiltering_hint.message:
Normally, searching from a sidebar tree's filter box will match all rows containing your search term(s).

When this option is enabled, for a row to match, all non-space characters in your search text must be present in the order you entered them, but not necessarily next to each other.

For example, suppose we have a row containing the text "Sidewise is great". When this option is disabled, a search for "wise" would match the row, but a search for "swgreat" would not. When this option is enabled, both searches would match the row.

Even when this option is disabled, a multiple-term search like "side great" would still match the row.
